p.span:
Updates a Context with specified parameters. The context is a 'Data Driven' context. If the type is 'average_centered', the fields avg, count, and stdev must be passed in via the search stream. If the type is 'domain', the fields count, max and min must be passed in via the search stream. If the type is 'median_centered', the fields median, count and stdev must be passed in via the search stream.
If a context/class does not exist, and the concepts parameter (terms) is set, then a new context/class will automatically be created. Default values will be used for endShape (curve), shape (pi), read (*), write (*), if they are not set. Other parameters will be set to "" if they are not set. See xsCreateUDContext for details about creating a User Defined Context instead of data from a search.

xsUpdateDDContext name=string terms="string(,string)*" count=int [class="string(,string)*"] [container=string] [endshape=(curve|linear)] [notes=string] [read=string] [scope=(private|app|global)] [search=string] [shape=(pi|trapezoid|triangle|curveincrease|curvedecrease|linearincrease|lineardecrease)] (type=average_centered avg=double stdev=double | type=domain min=double max=double) [uom=string] [write=string]

index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count avg(Height) as avg stdev(Height) as stdev by Gender | xsUpdateDDContext name=Height container=Height class=Gender scope=global terms="short,medium,tall" shape=pi endshape=curve type=average_centered uom=inches

Updates average_centered contexts (Height, Height/Male, Height/Female), centered at 0, with 3 terms (short, medium, tall) with count, avg and stdev passed in the search stream, using inches as the unit of measure (UOM).

| index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count min(Height) as min max(Height) as max by Gender | xsUpdateDDContext name=Height container=Height class=Gender scope=global terms="short,medium,tall" shape=pi endshape=curve type=domain uom=inches
Updates domain contexts (Height, Height/Male, Height/Female) with terms (short, medium, tall) with count, min, and max passed in the search stream, the unit of measure is inches.
avg, class, container, count, endshape, max, min, name, notes, read, scope, search, shape, stdev, terms, type, uom, write
The average value of the field. This parameter can be passed as part of the command or via search input using stats avg(field).

html.p: A comma separated list of classes.

p.span: The container to store the context.
The number of fields. This parameter can be passed as part of the command or via search input using stats count(field).
The shape of the end concepts. This defaults to curve.
The maximum value of the field. This parameter can be passed as part of the command or via search input using stats max(field).
The minimum value of the field. This parameter can be passed as part of the command or via search input using stats min(field).
A legal string which specifies the name of the Context to update.
A description of the context. This defaults to 'none'.
Read permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
Where to find the context (private, app, global) to update. This defaults to global.
The search string used to generate data
The shape of the middle concepts. This defaults to pi.
A comma delimited set of legal strings which define the names of the terms within the Context.
The standard deviation of the field values. This parameter can be passed as part of the command or via search input using stats stdev(field).
average_centered' - centers the context on the average and uses std dev. to scale term sizes
domain - the default, centers the set on (max-min)/2 and scales the context to cover the whole domain
Write permissions (i.e., roles). This defaults to * (for all roles).

The context updated by xsUpdateDDContext is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayContext for details about display of the created Context.
See xsUpdateUDContext for details about updating a Context using a 'generating' command instead of a 'streaming' command.
